title: GRAPH Presidents Job Approval Rating implication

content.description:
Refer to the line graph for the following question.

JOB APPROVAL RATINGS FOR PRESIDENTS, 1945-2012

Source: Gallup 2012.
content.question: Which of the following correctly identifies an implication of the line graph?

choices.label: Presidents are far more likely to make changes to the bureaucracy at the end of a second term than at the beginning of a first term.
Congress is more likely to act on a president’s policy proposal at the beginning of a first term than at the end of a second term.
The Supreme Court is more likely to rule on an important case at the beginning of a first term than at the end of a second term.
Presidents are more likely to send troops into conflict at the end of a second term than at the beginning of a first term.

content.answer: Congress is more likely to act on a president’s policy proposal at the beginning of a first term than at the end of a second term.

topic.text: 2.2: Structures, Powers, and Functions of Congress

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
